description: An introduction to concepts of calculus, for students who may encounter calculus in science and economics courses. Topics include: the analysis of functions and qualitative interpretations of the derivative and definite integral; occurrences of derivatives and integrals in geometry, probability, and physics; the computation of derivatives and antiderivatives of simple functions; computing derivatives and antiderivatives of more complicated functions with the aid of a computer.
title: Conceptual Calculus
